title: Integrated Graphics
body:
So my graphics card suddenly crashed and burned today and I need to buy a replacement and that might not be in for like 10 days or so. 
I have removed the graphics card from my computer and am using the motherboard integrated graphics instead. I don't think I can last 10 days or more without playing league or other games for that matter. 
I get an error when playing games in league saying that an unknown directx error has occurred and that I should update my video card drivers. Obviously this is impossible for me right now. Is there a way to play league by using integrated graphics?

replies.body:
Hey there,

Depending on how dated your CPU is, it's possible it doesn't support the DirectX version required to run the game.

If this is the case then you'll just have to wait it out until you can purchase a new card, you might want to look into a cheap card that supports at minimum **DirectX 9** and **Shader Version 2.0** if you do not have enough funds for something expensive.

Perhaps the [Nvidia Geforce GT 710](https://www.pccasegear.com/category/193_1423/graphics-cards/geforce-gt-710) might be a good choice for something on the cheap.

do you know how to check your intergrated graphics? run-> dxdiag , check display  ( look at the memory , display name ). Then , after you know the Integrated graphic , try to look up the 

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752654-Minimum-and-Recommended-System-Requirements


quote : 

Shader version 2.0 capable video card
Support for DirectX v9.0c or better

another source said : GeForce 8800 or equivalent video card (Dedicated GPU with 512MB+ Video Memory(VRAM))

if dxdiag not show this , use googling your integrated graphic name.


most GPU have specific driver , try to install , following with install directx driver.
